Package org.example

Class BattleShip

java.lang.Object
org.example.BattleShip
public class BattleShip extends Object
The BattleShip class represents the main class for a simple Battleship game where the user plays against the computer. It includes methods for setting up the game, playing the game, and checking for the winner.

    • setUpComputerShipGrenade

      public static void setUpComputerShipGrenade(org.example.BattleGround battleGround, Scanner sc)

      Parameters:
      battleGround - The BattleGround to set up.
      sc - The Scanner object for input.

    • getRandomCoord

      public static String getRandomCoord(Random random)
      Generates a random coordinate in the format A1 to H8.
      Parameters:
      random - The Random object for generating random values.
      Returns:
      A random coordinate in the format A1 to H8.

    • play

      public static void play(org.example.BattleGround battleGround, Scanner sc)
      Plays the Battleship game by taking turns between the user and the computer.
      Parameters:
      battleGround - The BattleGround to play on.
      sc - The Scanner object for input.

    • playGame

      public static void playGame(org.example.BattleGround battleGround, Scanner sc, Random random, String player)
      Plays a single turn of the game for the specified player (user or computer).
      Parameters:
      battleGround - The BattleGround to play on.
      sc - The Scanner object for input.
      random - The Random object for generating random coordinates.
      player - The current player ("user" or "computer").

    • isValidCoordinate

      public static boolean isValidCoordinate(String coord)
      Checks if the provided coordinate is in a valid format (e.g., A1, B2).
      Parameters:
      coord - The coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      true if the coordinate is valid, false otherwise.

    • isPositionOccupied

      public static boolean isPositionOccupied(org.example.BattleGround battleGround, String coord)
      Checks if the position at the specified coordinate on the BattleGround is already occupied.
      Parameters:
      battleGround - The BattleGround to check.
      coord - The coordinate to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is occupied, false otherwise.
